title: Predictable Random Number Generator

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

vulnerability_information_html:
Description:
The mobile application uses a predictable Random Number Generator (RNG).
Under certain conditions this weakness may jeopardize mobile application data encryption or other protection based on randomization. For example, if encryption tokens are generated inside of the application and an attacker can provide application with a predictable token to validate and then execute a sensitive activity within the application or its backend.

Example of insecure code:
Random random = new Random();
byte bytes[] = new byte[20];
random.nextBytes(bytes);

Example of secure code:
SecureRandom random = new SecureRandom();
byte bytes[] = new byte[20];
random.nextBytes(bytes);

Details:
There is 'new Random()' found in file 'org/jsoup/helper/DataUtil.java':
line 211: StringBuilder stringBuilder = new StringBuilder(32);

line 212: Random random = new Random();

line 213: for (int i = 0; i < 32; i++) {
There is 'new Random()' found in file 'com/owncloud/android/ui/notifications/NotificationUtils.java':
line 31: stringBuilder.append("NotificationDelayerThread_");

line 32: stringBuilder.append(new Random(System.currentTimeMillis()).nextInt());

line 33: HandlerThread handlerThread = new HandlerThread(stringBuilder.toString(), 10);
There is 'new Random()' found in file 'com/owncloud/android/jobs/MediaFoldersDetectionJob.java':
line 48: public static final String TAG = "MediaFoldersDetectionJob";

line 49: private Random randomId = new Random();

line 50:
There is 'new Random()' found in file 'com/owncloud/android/authentication/AuthenticatorActivity.java':
line 1672: stringBuilder2.append("OAuth_user");

line 1673: stringBuilder2.append(new Random(System.currentTimeMillis()).nextLong());

line 1674: str = stringBuilder2.toString();

Reference:
https://developer.android.com/reference/java/util/Random.html
https://developer.android.com/reference/java/security/SecureRandom.html

Impact

When a non-cryptographic PRNG is used in a cryptographic context, it can expose the cryptography to certain types of attacks.

Often a pseudo-random number generator (PRNG) is not designed for cryptography. Sometimes a mediocre source of randomness is sufficient or preferable for algorithms that use random numbers. Weak generators generally take less processing power and/or do not use the precious, finite, entropy sources on a system. While such PRNGs might have very useful features, these same features could be used to break the cryptography.

weakness.name: Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

activities.message:
Hello,

we changed this already with: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/3606
However, on all occurences this is is just used to have a random number, but it cannot be used to get any informations even if the random number is "guessed".

activities.message:
yes i agree with you no information get this . 

if you do this 

Example of insecure code:
Random random = new Random();   to  SecureRandom random = new SecureRandom(); 
it is better for product.
if in future it contains some information or store a bit value like
file 'org/jsoup/helper/DataUtil.java
StringBuilder stringBuilder = new StringBuilder[40]
"40 bits entropy" more or less means "there are only 240 possible values for the seed or internal PRNG state.

activities.message:
Thanks for your reply.
As mentioned, we changed this in all our app code.
Please report the "jsoup" issue to them, as we are only relying on this library.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for your reply.
As mentioned, we changed this in all our app code.

activities.message: sorry sir i dont get it your point .
activities.markdown_message: sorry sir i dont get it your point .

activities.message: He meant you should report the issue also to the jsoup library, because they also suffer from the reported issue.
activities.markdown_message: He meant you should report the issue also to the jsoup library, because they also suffer from the reported issue.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for your report. Much appreciated!

We're considering this a non-issue because it was fixed already in our code.

We'd like to encourage to keep hacking. We're looking forward to your next report!
